meanings.sent1: She carefully interfolded the napkins for the dinner party.
meanings.sent2: The fabric interfolded seamlessly, creating a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent3: The origami master could interfold paper with his eyes closed.
meanings.sent4: Their destinies seemed to interfold, leading them on a shared path.
meanings.sent5: The branches of the trees interfolded, creating a natural canopy above.

meanings.definition: To be folded together or intertwined.
meanings.sent1: The blankets interfold easily when stored in the closet.
meanings.sent2: The layers of rock interfolded over millions of years.
meanings.sent3: The dancers interfolded their arms gracefully during the performance.
meanings.sent4: Their lives interfolded like a complex puzzle, each piece fitting perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The DNA strands interfolded, forming the basis of genetic information.
